item.title: Investigating Multiplication on the Gameboy Advance
item.description: The Gameboy Advance has a pretty neat CPU - the ARM7TDMI. And by neat, I mean a chaotic and sadistic bundle of questionable design decisions. Seriously, they decided that the program counter should be a general purpose register. Why??? Insert simile here. I’m not even joking, you can use the program counter as the output to, say, an XOR instruction. Or an AND instruction.
